snippet: With Republicans pressing Mr. Ryan to seek the nomination, the House speaker held an unusually formal news conference to dismiss the idea.
abstract: House Speaker Paul Ryan continues to insist he will not seek or accept Republican nomination for president in 2016 as speculation over his plans grows stronger; many Republicans are despairing over Donald J Trump and Ted Cruz, and see Ryan as potential white knight.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Rome, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: With Republicans pressing Mr. Ryan to seek the nomination, the House speaker held an unusually formal news conference to dismiss the idea.

headline.main: Paul Ryan Rules Out Run for President
headline.print_headline: Turning Away Pleas, Ryan Rules Out Presidential Bid
